hero.title: Escape to Nature
hero.subtitle: 100% self-sufficient finca in the heart of Tarragona. Peace, disconnection, and sustainability.

about.intro: Finca Emmita is 10 mins drive from El Perello and 20 mins from the sea, we are in the middle of a valley, with no neighbours or roads nearby. All you can hear is the sound of silence. The finca is 100% self-sufficient. It is solar powered, we collect rain water and the grey water is recycled to water the vegetable garden and plants. We offer also high speed internet.
about.highlight: IF YOU ARE LOOKING FOR PEACE, QUIET, DISCONNECTION AND ENJOYING MOTHER NATURE, this is the place.
about.elPerello: The nearest village is El Perello, a small town which sits back 5 kilometres from the sea. Because of this it has not been developed as a tourist resort, and maintains a rustic charm. It is only a small town, but has all the facilities, cafe bars, restaurants, shops of all sorts, a small super-market, banks, a laundrette, a pharmacy and clinic, and a tourist office. There are internet facilities, and international newspapers are available at the newsagents. On Saturday morning there is a local market. El Perello is also famous for his local honey.

laCasita.title: La Casita
laCasita.shortDescription: Newly built log cabin with well-equipped kitchen, living room with sofa bed, and private terrace.
laCasita.longDescription: The Casita is newly built log cabin and offers a well-equipped small kitchen, a living room with a sofa bed and a pellet stove, a separated double bedroom. The bathroom has a large shower. There is a nice terrace with a table and chairs, sunloungers.

laOlivita.title: La Olivita
laOlivita.shortDescription: Newly renovated with mezzanine sleeping loft, wood burner, and terrace with BBQ.
laOlivita.longDescription: The Olivita is newly renovated and offers a well-equipped small kitchen, a living room with a sofa bed and a wood burner, the mezzanine sleeping loft has a double bed and is accessible by stairs. The bathroom has a large shower and a composting toilet. There is a nice terrace with a table and chairs, sunloungers and BBQ (not used from June to September due fire risks and it is replaced by a plancha)

host.title: Meet Emma
host.subtitle: Passionate about sustainable living & nature
host.bio1: Hello! I'm Emma, and I've been living at Finca Emmita since 2018. After years in the city, I decided to create a space where people could truly disconnect and reconnect with nature.
host.bio2: What started as a personal dream became a reality when I transformed this beautiful valley into a 100% self-sufficient retreat. Every aspect of the finca - from solar panels to rainwater harvesting - reflects my commitment to sustainable living.
host.bio3: I love sharing this peaceful paradise with guests who appreciate the beauty of simplicity, the sound of silence, and the magic of starlit nights without light pollution. Whether you need recommendations for local hiking trails or tips for sustainable living, I'm always happy to help!

host.typicallyResponds: Typically responds within a few hours
